abstract: Apple’s chief has said that the company paid about 30.5 percent in taxes on its profits. The author examines cash tax payments to the Treasury Department and estimates that it’s probably closer to 8.2 percent.
snippet: Apple’s chief has said that the company paid about 30.5 percent in taxes on its profits. The author examines cash tax payments to the Treasury Department and estimates that it’s probably closer to 8.2 percent.
lead_paragraph: One lesson from the Senate hearing about Apple’s offshore tax planning is that figuring out what a multinational company actually pays in taxes is harder than it should be. At the risk of sounding Clintonesque, it depends on what the meaning of “pays” is.

headline.main: Calculating Apple’s True U.S. Tax Rate

abstract: James B. Comey, President Obama’s reported choice for F.B.I. director, may be able to offer insight into the culture at Bridgewater Associates.
snippet: James B. Comey, President Obama’s reported choice for F.B.I. director, may be able to offer insight into the culture at Bridgewater Associates.
lead_paragraph: In the revolving door between Washington and Wall Street, President Obama’s planned F.B.I. nominee, James B. Comey, will be just the latest to spin through. And it’s not unusual that the financial institution where Mr. Comey, a former deputy attorney general, had worked was a hedge fund — you may recall that Lawrence H. Summers, the former Treasury secretary, had a short spell at D. E. Shaw, making millions.

headline.main: F.B.I. Pick Could Offer Look Into World of Ray Dalio
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Pick Could Offer Look Into World of Ray Dalio
